properties.publicTransport: Route 356, 373 and 375 buses will be detouring. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Spot Festival in Randwick on St Pauls Street and Perouse Road from 1pm until 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads in the area while crowds travel to and from the event, and road closures are in place. Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

From 4am, sections of Perouse Road and St Pauls Street will be closed until midnight. Motorists will be detoured via local roads. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in the area on sections of Perouse Road, St Pauls Street, Nancy Street and Soudan Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Nights markets will be held on Haldon Street, The Boulevard and Railway Parade in Lakemba every Thursday to Sunday, 6pm-3am from 9 March to 8 April.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly during the busy weeknight peaks on Thursdays and Fridays during the event.

Changed traffic conditions will be in place each night, motorists should allow plenty of extra time

Road closures from 5pm to 3am each night from 9 March to 8 April.  

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 3,000 particpants are expected to take part in this year's Bobbin Head Cycle Classic. Events start and finish at Karuah Oval in Turramurra, from 6:30am. All events will finish by 1:30pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

  • Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm, including on sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, General San Martin Dr, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah, St Ives and Terry Hills. 
  • Speed limit reductions will be in effect at key locations along the course at various times between 6am and 2pm.

A special event clearway will also be in place on the eastern side of a section of Mona Vale Rd in St Ives from 7am until 1:30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Storm at McDonald Jones Stadium. Preliminary game from 2:15pm. NRL kick-off from 6:30pm, finish around 8:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Public transport will operate as usual. Traffic delays may affect some bus route(s), noting that Route 12, 22, 24, 26, 28 & 47 will be rerouted around Steel Street and via Union Street, for the duration of the event.
properties.otherAdvice: Great Southern Nights festival of live music will showcase established household names to emerging talents and grassroots acts.
properties.diversions: Steel Street will be closed from 4am on Saturday 23 March to midnight on Sunday 24 March.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed outside the stadium. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Sea Eagles at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 4.05pm and full time 5.50pm.

With more than 20,000 fans expected traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 5.30pm to 6.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St between Grose St and George St
  • Ross St between O’Connell St and Trott St
  • Victoria Rd between O’Connell St and Villiers St

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. Fans travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail and buses run regularly to Moore Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show will be held at The Entertainment Quarter from Saturday 23 March to Monday 1 April from 10am to 5pm daily, except 25-28 March 10am to 3pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from the Show each day. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

The precinct will be particularly busy while events are held at neighbouring Allianz Stadium, Sydney Cricket Ground and Hordern Pavilion so allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in demand on these days.

If you are attending the Show on Saturday 23 March, expect delays in and around the precinct as a music festival also takes place at nearby Centennial Park from 11:30am. As well, AFL fans will also be making their way into the precinct from 5:30pm so expect delays if you are leaving the Show at the end of the day.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park on game days during the Show including Saturday 23, Thursday 28, Friday 29 and Saturday 30 March so check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of music fans are expected to attend the annual Byron Bay Bluesfest at Bryon Bay Events Farm, just north of Byron Bay over the Easter Long Weekend from Thursday 28 March until Monday 1 April 2024.

Traffic may be heavier than usual from Wednesday 27 March on the M1 Pacific Motorway at Tyagarah, and Ewingsdale Rd and Gulgan Rd interchanges on approach to the event.

Local roads around Tyagarah may also be busy. 

Motorists should exercise caution and follow the direction of traffic controllers and signage along the motorway directing motorists to the festival site. 

Motorists travelling to Bluesfest or travelling in the area over the Easter long weekend should allow extra travel time and expect delays. Consider alternate routes or travelling outside the peak crowd arrival/departure times to avoid some of the delays.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Crown Street on Saturday 6 April. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 9am until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson Ln, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Ln will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SURRY HILLS

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Arthur Street between Tudor Lane and Crown Street
  • Arthur Street between Crown Street and Collins Lane
  • Collins Street between Crown Street and Richards Lane
  • Crown Street between Cleveland Street and Foveaux Street

4 Resident exit via 2-way contra flow from High Holborn Street to Lansdowne Street.


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Lansdowne St between Crown St and 20m west of Crown St

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Electric Gardens Festival at Royal Randwick Racecourse from 2pm to 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the fesitval.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, and event shuttle buses will run from Caringbah, Cronulla and Woolooware train stations before and after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Raiders at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Jersey Flegg kick-off at 4pm. NRL kick-off at 6.15pm, full time around 8.05pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains will be running. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Bulldogs Good Friday clash at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 1.40pm. NRL kick-off at 4pm, full time around 5.45pm.

With up to 30,000 footy fans expected to attend and the Sydney Royal Easter Show also taking place in the precinct, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park.

Good Friday is typically the busiest day during the Easter Show, motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: Pre-booked parking in the precinct is selling fast for Good Friday 29 March.
  • Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space. P5 and P6 car parks are closed during the Easter Show.
  • Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking as there will be no parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Road closures and changes to parklands are in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct from Friday 8 March to Wednesday 10 April for the Royal Easter Show. Check out the interactive map or the community information page for more details.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue (Bus access for route buses to rear of station)
  • Herb Elliott Avenue closed at Park Street.

From 8pm Sunday 25 February to 3am Monday 26 February

  • Edwin Flack Avenue from Pondage Link to Old Hill Link (westbound). Route Buses will be allowed access through closure via Pondage Link Avenue.
  • Edwin Flack Avenue North bound from Bernie Avenue to Old Hill Link. Route Buses will be allowed access through closure

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Campbelltown Sports Stadium on Easter Monday. Kick-off from 3pm, full time around 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Sea Eagles at WIN Stadium. Kick-off from 5.30pm, full time approx 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Women: Central Coast Mariners v Western United at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 7pm, finish around 8.50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 5pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in race day tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Autumn Carnival – Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.10pm, last race from 5.50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A special event clearway will be in effect on Grand Ave from 6am to 8pm from 100m prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North (southern side/ westbound direction).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

NRL: Eels v Wests Tigers at CommBank Stadium on Easter Monday. NSW Cup kick-off at 1.40pm. NRL kick-off at 4pm, full time around 5.45pm.

With up to 30,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 5.30pm to 6.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St between Grose St and George St
  • Ross St between O’Connell St and Trott St
  • Victoria Rd between O’Connell St and Villiers St

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. Fans travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Easter long weekend between 29 March and 1 April.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Audley, Maianbar, and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park, via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford, will close.

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will be managing access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr

  • Contraflow traffic conditions will take place on the Princes Hwy at Waterfall from 8pm on Saturday 30th March with changed access to McKell Ave
  • Garie Rd is closed from Sir Bertram Stevens Dr
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Easter long weekend

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lane closures will be in place on Market Street in the Sydney CBD as crowds are expected to attend a film premiere at the State Theatre from 5:30pm.

From 3am until midnight, lane 1 of the southern side Market St and lane 4 of the northern side of Market St will be closed between Pitt St and George St.

The footpath on the southern side of Market St will also be closed between Pitt St and George St from 10am until 10pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading info

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market extended Easter Trading Hours will take place on Good Friday of the Easter Long Weekend. Retailers will be open from 5am-5pm on Good Friday 29 March. Business will continue as usual over the remainder of the long weekend, with retailers open from 7am-4pm daily from 30 March until 1 April.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area. Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time.

Limited parking is available on-site at the Sydney Fish Market car park and will be in high demand.

Additional parking will be available nearby on Good Friday only at the Sydney Secondary College, entry via Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic controllers, when car parks reach capacity motorists will be redirected.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Concerts will be held at Qudos Bank Arena in Olympic Park during the Sydney Royal Easter Show:

  • Sat 23 March – Joker Xue (薛之谦) from 8pm
  • Sat 30 March – $UICIDEBOY$ from 6.30pm

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while thousands of Easter Show attendees also travel to and from the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

  • PARKING UPDATE: all available pre-booked parking spaces are SOLD OUT on Saturday 23 March. If you haven't pre-booked parking, do not drive. You'll need to catch public transport as there is no casual parking available on site. 

Road closures and changes to parklands are in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct until Wednesday 10 April for the Royal Easter Show. Check out the interactive map or the community information page for more details.

arrangementElements.html:
1.30am, Friday 8 March to 1.30am Wednesday 10 April inclusive:

  • Olympic Boulevard 100m north of Dawn Fraser Avenue adjacent to Cathy Freeman Park amenities, to 200m south of Edwin Flack Avenue outside Qudos Bank Arena.
  • Australia Avenue from Murray Rose Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue.
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Grand Parade.
  • Grand Parade from Olympic Boulevard to Australia Avenue.

1.30am Friday 22 March to 1.30am Tuesday 3 April inclusive:

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link.
  • Marjorie Jackson Parkway from Wentworth Common Carpark to Australia Avenue
  • Olympic Boulevard from Kevin Coombs to Sarah Durack Avenue.
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue.
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15 (fixed closure) and Park Street
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Edwin Flack Avenue to Showground Road (Accessible drop-off / pick-up and Show drop-off / pick-up – Edwin Flack Avenue to Fig Grove).
  • Shirley Strickland Avenue from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard.
  • Shirley Strickland Avenue from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park).
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland Avenue to the Tennis Centre.
  • Shane Gould Avenue at P2 Car Park
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Easter Bunny Bazaar will be held on Saturday 30 March along John Street (Newell Highway) from 7.30am until 2pm and includes street stalls and musical entertainment.
properties.diversions: Northbound traffic will be detoured via Cassilis, Robertson and Dalgarno streets and southbound traffic will be detoured via Essex, Charles and Edward streets.

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Burrawang Easter Market will take place on Saturday 30 March between 8 am and 3 pm.

A speed reduction of 60 km/h will be in place on the Illawarra Highway.

Local closures and detours will also be in place.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is included in tickets to the Show. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run daily. Regular route buses 525, 526 and N81 in Olympic Park will use different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show over 12 days at Sydney Olympic Park from Friday 22 March until Tuesday 2 April. 

  • Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd throughout the show. 
  • PARKING UPDATE: all available pre-booked parking spaces are SOLD OUT on Saturday 23 and Sunday 24 March. Parking for Good Friday 29 March is nearly sold out. If you haven't pre-booked parking, do not drive. You'll need to catch public transport as there is no casual parking available on site. 
  • Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Consider parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train or bus to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked follow directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Road closures and changes to parklands are in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct from Friday 8 March until Wednesday 10 April before, during and after the Easter Show including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr. Check out the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map for more details.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures

Road closures and changes to parklands will be in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct before, during and after the Show for event set up and pack down. Check out the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map for more details. 

1.30am, Friday 8 March to 1.30am Wednesday 10 April inclusive:

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

properties.publicTransport:
Buses will be diverting while roads are closed.

L2 and L3 Light Rail services may also be impacted.

Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for real-time information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place between approximately 2:30pm and 4pm due to a planned police operation:

  • St James between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • Elizabeth St between Hunter St and Park St
  • Elizabeth St between Park St and King St
  • Castlereagh St between King St and Market St
  • Market St between Elizabeth St and York St

roads.mainStreet: St James Road, Elizabeth Street, York Street, Druitt Street, Park Street, Pitt Street, Market Street

properties.otherAdvice: The Cowra Festival of Understanding is a four day community based event which focuses on the Cowra's unique place as the home of reconciliation. A parade will be held on Saturday 23 March in the main street requiring a full closure of Kendall St (Mid Western Hwy) from 2.30pm to 4.30 pm. A detour will be in place and 2 x VMS will be deployed one week prior to the parade in advance of both closure points.
properties.diversions: Detour (all vehicles both directions) College Dr, Liverpool St and Lachlan St.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Bulldogs v Titans. Preliminary game from 12:40pm. NRL kick-off from 3pm. Finish around 4:45pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Belmore Sports Ground as fans make their way to the game.

Parking is limited on local streets and car parks in the area. 

Attendees driving to the game should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads

Up to 1,500 cyclists will take part in the 170km Maxi Classic and 110km Challenge Classic from 8am. Both rides start and finish at Banjo Patterson Park in Jindabyne and travel via Rocky Plain, Berridale, Dalgety and Beloka. The 170km ride continues to Perisher before returning to Jindabyne.

Major Road closures (please visit the Cycling Classics website for more detailed road closure information).

  • Jindabyne - between 5am and 7pm: sections of Kosciuszko Rd between Banjo Paterson Cres/Thredbo Tce & Barry Way at Banjo Patterson Park will be closed from 5am until 9:30am and from 5pm until 7pm. Local detours will be in place. From 9:30am until 5:30pm traffic will be reduced to one lane in both directions using northern/lake side lanes and the speed limited will be reduced 40km/h.
  • Jindabyne to East Jindabyne - 7:15am to 9:15am: Kosciuszko Rd from Munyang St/Banjo Patterson Cres to Eucumbene Rd closed. 
  • East Jindabyne to Rocky Plain - 7:15am to 10am: Eucumbene Rd from Kosciuszko Rd to Rocky Plain Rd closed.
  • Rocky Plain to Berridale - between 8am and 10.45am: Rocky Plain Rd from Eucumbene Rd to Middlingbank Rd. From 8:30am until 11:10am Middlingbank Rd between Rocky Plain Rd and Jindabyne Rd closed.
  • Berridale - between 8.30am and 11:30am: Myack St from Kosciuszko Rd to Bobundara Rd closed.
  • Berridale to Dalgety - between 8.30am and 12.45pm: Dalgety Rd and Campbell St from Bobundara Rd to the Snowy River Way closed.
  • Dalgety to Jindabyne - 9am to 3pm: Snowy River Way from Campbell St, Dalgety to Barry Way closed. From 9.45am until 3.15pm Barry Way closed from from Snowy River Way to Kosciuszko Rd, Jindabyne.
  • Jindabyne to Perisher - 10am to 5.15pm: Kosciuszko Rd from Alpine Way to Perisher Village closed. No access to or from Perisher until 5.15pm.

Some local roads will also be closed and access will be restricted, follow directions of traffic control on site.

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time along the detour routes.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in race day tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Autumn Carnival – Golden Slipper Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11:50pm, last race from 5:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A special event clearway will be in place on Grand Ave from 6am to 8pm from 100m prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North (southern side/ westbound direction).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Cowboys at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Preliminary game at 3:10pm. Main game kick-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly to ES Marks stop. Travel on rail is included in participants entry tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Track Classic at ES Marks Athletics Field from 6pm to 8.30pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Anzac Pde and Boronia St approaching the venue, and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Roads will be busy in the area as other events take place throughout the day in the nearby Moore Park and Centennial Park precincts.

Roads closures will be in place in nearby Centennial Park and Moore Park from 8:30pm to allow crowds from other events safely leave the area. Allow extra travel time as you are leaving and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads.

A Day on the Green will be held at Centennial Vineyards on 23 March from 2pm to 9.30pm.

Reduced speed and stop-slow traffic management will be in place on Mittagong Rd as motorists arrive and leave the event.

Centennial Rd will be closed from Centennial Vineyards to the Old Hume Highway.

Traffic controllers will be on-site to direct motorists.

roads.crossStreet: Centennial Vinyards to Old Hume Highway

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Sharks at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 7.35pm and full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to the match.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney – Sydney Streets on Harris Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses are diverting around road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways are in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Harris St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures are in place from 9am until11:30pm on:

  • Harris St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and John St
  • Miller St between Little Mount St and Harris St
  • Miller St between Saunders St and Little Mount Street (eastbound)
  • Union St between Harris St and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders St between exit of Saunders St and Miller St (eastbound)
  • Motorists will be detoured via Pyrmont St and John St.

Special event clearways are effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Harris St and Miller St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

PYRMONT

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Harris Street 1 between Pyrmont Bridge Road and John Street
  • Miller Street between Little Mount Street and Harris Street
  • Miller Street 2 between Saunders Street and Little Mount Street (eastbound)
  • Union Street between Harris Street and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders Street 3 between exit of Saunders Street and Miller Street (eastbound)

Notes

1. Resident Access between John St and Union Square under traffic control

2. Resident Access Permitted

3. Resident Access between Saunders Street and Miller Street under traffic control

 

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Harris Street between Pyrmont Bridge Road and John Street
  • Miller Street between Little Mount Street and Harris Street
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special event clearways

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in festival tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Knotfest at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 11.30am to 10pm

Heavy traffic and long delays are expected particularly in the evening when leaving after the event as roads are closed while up to 30,000 AFL fans leave nearby SCG at the same time.

Other events including the Sydney Family Show in the Entertainment Quarter will also be held during the day making parking very limited and in high demand.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the event as long delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Road closures will be in place:

  • From 4pm: Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • From 8.30pm to midnight: Lang Rd will be closed at Oxford St and Anzac Pde. Access to EQ precinct is via Moore Park Rd and Cook Rd only until 10pm.
  • From 10pm to midnight: Moore Park Rd eastbound from Oatley Rd to Oxford St will be closed, as well as the Eastern Distributor Bondi Exit. Detour around the precinct via Oxford St or Anzac Pde and Alison Rd. No access into the EQ precinct during this time. The Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde exit will remain open. Sections of local roads in Surry Hills and around the Entertainment Quarter will also be closed to manage traffic flow while both event crowds leave at the same time. Access will be maintained for residents.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park, Centennial Park and surrounding areas between 10am and midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads will be closed in Centennial Park and Moore Park for the safety of pedestrians leaving the event.

From 4pm to midnight

  • Driver Avenue between the southern turning circle and northern turning circle (both directions)

From 8:30pm to midnight

  • Driver Avenue between Lang Road and the southern turning circle (northbound)
  • Lang Road between Anzac Parade and Driver Avenue (eastbound)
  • Lang Road* between Oxford Street and Mitchell Street (both directions)
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Cook Road (westbound)

From 10pm to midnight

  • Cook Road* between Darvall Street and Centennial Lane (southbound)
  • Driver Avenue between Moore Park Road and the northern turning circle (southbound)
  • Eastern Distributor Bondi Exit onto Moore Park Road (eastbound)
  • Lang Road* between Cook Road and Darvall Street (westbound)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Erol Flynn Boulevard (westbound)
  • Moore Park Road between Oatley Road and Oxford Street (eastbound)
  • Renny Street* between Oatley Road and Renny Lane (eastbound)
  • Robertson Road** between Lang Road and Martin Road (both directions)
  • Stewart Street* between Oatley Road and Alexander Street (eastbound)

*managed access for residents only

** managed access for residents when safe to do so

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Essendon Bombers at the SCG. First bounce 7:30pm, finish at 10:10pm.

With more than 30,000 fans expected traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Other events including the Sydney Family Show in the Entertainment Quarter will also be held during the day making parking very limited and in high demand.

In the evening, traffic will also be heavy after the game as roads will be closed while up to 15,000 music festival attendees leave neighbouring Centennial Park at the same time.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as long delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Road closures will be in place:

  • From 4pm: Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd.
  • From 8.30pm to midnight: Lang Rd will be closed at Oxford St and Anzac Pde. Access to EQ precinct is via Moore Park Rd and Cook Rd only until 10pm.
  • From 10pm to midnight: Moore Park Rd eastbound from Oatley Rd to Oxford St will be closed, as well as the Eastern Distributor Bondi Exit. Detour around the precinct via Oxford St or Anzac Pde and Alison Rd. No access into the EQ precinct during this time. The Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde exit will remain open. Sections of local roads in Surry Hills and around the Entertainment Quarter will also be closed to manage traffic flow while both event crowds leave at the same time. Access will be maintained for residents

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas between 10am and midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The Warren Community Triathlon will be held on Sunday 24 March 2024. With 70-100 entrants expected the swim leg is at the local pool and the cycle and run legs are around local roads. There will be stop slow control implemented on the Oxley Highway at Industrial Access Rd intersection and Dubbo Rd round about

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for real-time information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5,000 people are expected to take part in the Greek Independence Day March through the Sydney CBD from Martin Place to the Opera House at Circular Quay.

Delays are expected in the city while roads are closed. Motorists should avoid the area or expect delays, allow plenty of extra travel time and follow directions of NSW Police.

Road closures will be in place between 1:30pm and 3pm:

  • Pitt St between Bridge St and King St
  • Bridge St between Macquarie St and Pitt St,
  • Grosvenor St/Bridge St between Harrington St and Pitt St (eastbound)
  • Macquarie St between Bridge St and the Sydney Opera House, and northbound lanes from Bent St to Bridge St
  • Hunter St between George St and Pitt St
  • Sections of Spring St, Gresham, St, Phillip St, Bent St and Loftus St will also be closed.

Limited access will be maintained for vehicles to exit some closed roads during the march when safe to do so.

arrangementElements.html:
Road Closures Sunday 24 March between 1:30pm and 3pm

  • Pitt St: between Bridge St and King St (southbound closed – one way street)
  • Bridge St: between Pitt St and Macquarie St (both directions closed)
  • Macquarie St: between Bridge St and the Sydney Opera House (both directions closed)
  • Macquarie St: between Bent St and Bridge St (northbound)
  • Grosvenor St: between Harrington St and George St (eastbound closed)
  • Bridge St: between George St and Bridge St (eastbound closed)
  • Hunter St: between George St and Pitt St
